intro: Arrabidaea ornithophila, commonly known as the bird's wing or the winged bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, winged pods that enclose its seeds. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it a valuable plant for soil enrichment. The seeds of Arrabidaea ornithophila are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines in some parts of Africa.
